meanings.definition: Practice (an action or skill) for a performance or presentation.
meanings.sent1: She likes to rehearse her lines before the school play.
meanings.sent2: The band will rehearse the song one more time before the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to rehearse its meowing skills at 3 AM.
meanings.sent4: The dancers rehearse their moves like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: He rehearsed his speech until he could recite it in his sleep.

meanings.definition: Repeat aloud or recite from memory.
meanings.sent1: The students will rehearse the poem in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: She likes to rehearse the lyrics of her favorite song.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to rehearse its favorite phrases all day long.
meanings.sent4: Her memories rehearse themselves in her mind like a play.
meanings.sent5: He would rehearse the lines of the play until they were perfect.

meanings.definition: To go over or review in preparation for a future event.
meanings.sent1: They need to rehearse the presentation before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Let's rehearse the plan one more time before the big day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to rehearse where it hid its nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: The waves rehearse crashing against the shore in a never-ending dance.
meanings.sent5: She would rehearse the steps of the experiment to ensure accuracy.
